name: 吳亦超
objective: This course aims to to develop modern Android mobile applications. Android Studio will be the main development platform with the Java programming language to build a complete knowledge system for mobile device development. It also introduces TensorFlow Lite to import basic AI inference functions to understand how to integrate artificial intelligence modules on mobile platforms.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to Course and Android Studio
Week 2: Java Programming I
Week 3: Java Programming II
Week 4: Basic Interface and Message Display Components
Week 5: CheckBox, RadioButton, and Spinner
Week 6: ImageView
Week 7: ListView
Week 8: Option Menu
Week 9: Project Proposal
Week 10: Intent
Week 11: Files
Week 12: MediaPlayer
Week 13: Database
Week 14: Google API
Week 15: Paper Presentation
Week 16: Examples Practices I - Android Studio with AI
Week 17: Examples Practices II - Android Studio with AI
Week 18: Final Project Demo
scorePolicy:
1. Attendance: 10%
2. Homework (Include Quiz): 25%
3. Paper Presentation: 10%
4. Project Proposal: 20%
5. Final Project: 35%
materials:
1. Self-Compiled Teaching Material
2. Paul J. Deitel, Harvey M. Deitel, Abbey Deitel, and Michael Morgano, "Android for Programmers: An App-Driven Approach", Prentice Hall. ISBN: 9780132121361.
課程對應SDGs指標: SDG1：消除貧窮（No Poverty）SDG2：消除飢餓（Zero Hunger）SDG4：優質教育（Quality Education）SDG8：尊嚴就業與經濟發展（Decent Work and Economic Growth）SDG9：產業創新與基礎設施（Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure）
課程是否導入AI: ● 鼓勵學生使用生成式 AI 工具（Encourage students to use generative AI tools）● 簡單介紹 AI 的基本概念（Briefly introduce the basic concept of AI）
remarks: The course progress will be fine-tuned according to the actual class situation.The examination will include project proposal and final project demo.
